comment.author: 32967294@N05
comment._content:
I suspect this may be Alice an elephant that was at 'Wonderland City' at Tamamara Bondi Sydney. It appears she may have been obtained by Wirth's Circus around mid - late 1908.

Later on Wirth's claimed falsely they had Alice the companion of P.T Barnum's Jumbo, Alice was in fact an African Bush Elephant and not an Asian elephant. So Wirth's Claims were completely untrue.

comment.author: 32967294@N05
comment._content: This is indeed Alice of Wonderland City fame. Wirth's Circus bought her from William Anderson in 1908 by the 1920's Alice was well travelled with the circus and with her came the myth that she was over 100 years old. Alice was born around 1876. She was owned by Bostock & Wombwell's Circus and Menagerie until 1906 when she was auctioned and bought by William Anderson. After Wirth's Circos obtained her they changed her name to 'Princess Alice' Alice died at Wirth's Circus in Melbourne in November 1941

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: This elephant has small ears so I don't think it is an African elephant.

comment.author: 32967294@N05
comment._content: Quite right she is an Asian elephant. The Alice PT Barnum had was an African so Wirth's were trying to make it up as they went along. They claimed Alice was 150 years old when she died but in fact she was around aged 65 years old.
